get.description: Returns the full-game core odds for games in a given date. This means moneyline, spread, and total. Only returns the most recently seen odds, not-including line movement.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-11-20, 2018-11-23.

get.description: Returns the full-game core odds for a given GameID. This means moneyline, spread, and total. Only returns the most recently seen odds, not-including line movement. This endpoint has a longer cache as it is meant for historical data/line movement rather than the most up to the second line.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an CBB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 17775 or 17776

get.description: Provides in-play odds data for a given date. This means odds for games which are in-progress. Only serves the most recently seen data & does not include line movement.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-11-20, 2018-11-23.

get.description: Returns in-play game odds (spread, moneyline, total) for games on a given date. Returns the full line movement for the given game. This endpoint has a longer cache as it is meant for historical data/line movement rather than the most up to the second line.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an CBB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 17775 or 17776

get.description: Returns the non-full-game odds for games on a given date. This means odds such as 1st-half, rather than full game. Only returns the most recently seen odds, not-including line movement.
get.summary: Alternate Market Pre-Game Odds - by Date

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-11-20, 2018-11-23.

get.description: Returns the non-full-game odds for games in a given GameID. This means odds such as 1st-half, rather than full game. Returns the full line movement for the given game. This endpoint has a longer cache as it is meant for historical data/line movement rather than the most up to the second line.
get.summary: Alternate Market Pre-Game Odds Line Movement

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an CBB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 17775 or 17776

get.description: Describes recent team trends and performance against betting data in recent sets of games

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: OU, UK.

get.description: Returns trends data for a given pairing of teams. Will return data even if the teams are not set to play this season. Intended for use on a specific game though it will work for other comparisons if applicable.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: OU, UK.

parameters.name: opponent
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested opponent.
Examples: OU, UK.

get.description: The list of current BettingEvents for the given date, from which Betting Market data can be gathered via the Betting Markets by Event endpoint, for all available Betting Market types (e.g. Player Props, Team Props.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-11-20, 2018-11-23.

get.description: The list of current BettingEvents for the given season, from which Betting Market data can be gathered via the Betting Markets by Event endpoint, for all available Betting Market types (e.g. Player Props, Team Props.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season
Examples: 2020, 2021, etc.

get.description: Returns available Futures markets for the given season. Does not include line movement.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season
Examples: 2020, 2021, etc.

get.description: Returns full line movement for a given BettingMarket. Due to the sheer size of the output and the level of detail, it is intended for historical data purposes and not for the most up-to-the-second lines.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: marketId
parameters.description: The MarketId of the desired market for which to pull all outcomes/bets.

get.description: Returns the markets of all available types (e.g. Player Props, Team Props) and available outcomes for a given BettingEventID.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The EventId of the desired event/game for which to pull all betting markets (includes outcomes/bets).

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
This parameter indicates which BettingOutcome records to return in the payload. By default, this endpoint only returns available outcomes, excluding the unlisted bets.

Important Note: the default parameter of available is much faster and provides the best performance. Passing unlisted will return unlisted odds, but these are cached for much longer and may be several minutes old. For best performance, the default parameter is highly recommended.

Possible values include:

available - excludes any betting outcomes that have been removed/unlisted by the respective sportsbook. This is more lightweight and delivers odds much faster than using unlisted.

unlisted - includes the most recently available betting outcome per sportsbook, for each listed market, even those outcomes are expired/unlisted or otherwise unavailable from the respective sportsbook. This is a far heavier payload, and it's cached for much longer than available.

get.description: Returns the markets of all available types (e.g. Player Props, Team Props) and available outcomes for a given GameID.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of the desired game for which to pull all betting markets (includes outcomes/bets).

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
This parameter indicates which BettingOutcome records to return in the payload. By default, this endpoint only returns available outcomes, excluding the unlisted bets.

Important Note: the default parameter of available is much faster and provides the best performance. Passing unlisted will return unlisted odds, but these are cached for much longer and may be several minutes old. For best performance, the default parameter is highly recommended.

Possible values include:

available - excludes any betting outcomes that have been removed/unlisted by the respective sportsbook. This is more lightweight and delivers odds much faster than using unlisted.

unlisted - includes the most recently available betting outcome per sportsbook, for each listed market, even those outcomes are expired/unlisted or otherwise unavailable from the respective sportsbook. This is a far heavier payload, and it's cached for much longer than available.

get.description: Returns Markets and available outcomes for a given event and market type requested. A lighter call than by BettingEventID as it only includes markets tagged with the specific MarketType, a full list of which is available for each sport in its Betting Metadata endpoint.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The EventId of the desired event/game for which to pull all betting markets (includes outcomes/bets).

parameters.name: marketTypeID
parameters.description: The Market Type ID of the desired MarketTypes to pull. Some common types include: 1 for Game Lines, 2 for Player Props, 3 for Team Props, 6 for Game Props

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
This parameter indicates which BettingOutcome records to return in the payload. By default, this endpoint only returns available outcomes, excluding the unlisted bets.

Important Note: the default parameter of available is much faster and provides the best performance. Passing unlisted will return unlisted odds, but these are cached for much longer and may be several minutes old. For best performance, the default parameter is highly recommended.

Possible values include:

available - excludes any betting outcomes that have been removed/unlisted by the respective sportsbook. This is more lightweight and delivers odds much faster than using unlisted.

unlisted - includes the most recently available betting outcome per sportsbook, for each listed market, even those outcomes are expired/unlisted or otherwise unavailable from the respective sportsbook. This is a far heavier payload, and it's cached for much longer than available.

get.description: Returns the list of MarketTypes, BetTypes, PeriodTypes, OutcomeTypes, and ResultTypes to map the IDs to descriptive names. Also includes a list of the MarketType, BetType & PeriodType combinations which we will have resulting for.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: A list of all available sportsbooks with their associated unique IDs.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: List of Money and Bet Percentage splits for each outcome type available in this market. This specific endpoint will return the movement from this market as well as the most recent.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: marketId
parameters.description: The MarketId of the desired market for which to pull splits. MarketIds are pulled from the Betting Markets endpoints.

get.description: List of Money and Bet Percentage splits for each market and their respective outcome types available in this game. This specific endpoint will return current splits for each available market and no line movement.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameId
parameters.description: The ID of the game for which you want to receive splits for. GameIds are pulled from the Schedules and Games by Date endpoints.

get.description: This works in the same way as Betting Markets by Market Type but is prefiltered to the Player Props type only. Ideal if your application will only ever require Player Props, but if you also want Team Props etc. it is recommended to use the by Market Type endpoint.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameId
parameters.description: The unique GameID of the game in question.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
This parameter indicates which BettingOutcome records to return in the payload. By default, this endpoint only returns available outcomes, excluding the unlisted bets.

Important Note: the default parameter of available is much faster and provides the best performance. Passing unlisted will return unlisted odds, but these are cached for much longer and may be several minutes old. For best performance, the default parameter is highly recommended.

Possible values include:

available - excludes any betting outcomes that have been removed/unlisted by the respective sportsbook. This is more lightweight and delivers odds much faster than using unlisted.

unlisted - includes the most recently available betting outcome per sportsbook, for each listed market, even those outcomes are expired/unlisted or otherwise unavailable from the respective sportsbook. This is a far heavier payload, and it's cached for much longer than available.

get.description: Provide a market ID that supports resulting (i.e. has a ResultType) and this endpoint will return a result: for markets with a ResultType, each line will be graded and it will be determined whether the bet would have won or lost.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: marketId
parameters.description: BettingMarketID of the market for which you would like to see resulted outcomes. Valid example ID 96401, 93518

get.description: Returns the full-game and non-full-game odds (spread, moneyline, total) for games in a given week and season. Only returns the most recently seen odds, not inclusive of line movement. A Sportsbook Group must be specified as a URL parameter.
get.summary: Pre-Game and Period Game Odds - by Date [Sportsbook Group]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-11-20, 2018-11-23.

parameters.name: sportsbookgroup
parameters.description:
The name of the Sportsbook grouping.
Examples: G1100

get.description: Returns the game odds ( for games on a given date. In this endpoint both full-game and partial-game odds are included. Returns the full line movement for the given game. This endpoint has a longer cache as it is meant for historical data/line movement rather than the most up to the second line. A Sportsbook Group must be specified as a URL parameter.
get.summary: Pre-Game and Period Game Odds Line Movement [Sportsbook Group]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an CBB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 17775 or 17776

parameters.name: sportsbookgroup
parameters.description:
The name of the Sportsbook grouping.
Examples: G1100

get.description: Returns in-play game odds (spread, moneyline, total) for games on a given date. Only returns the most recently seen odds, not inclusive of line movement. As this is in-game, it will only return results while the game is in progress. A Sportsbook Group must be specified as a URL parameter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-11-20, 2018-11-23.

parameters.name: sportsbookgroup
parameters.description:
The name of the Sportsbook grouping.
Examples: G1100

parameters.description: The GameID of an CBB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 17775 or 17776

parameters.name: sportsbookgroup

The name of the Sportsbook grouping.
